extendedIngredients.name: red velvet cake mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 box Red Velvet Cake Mix (prepared according to package)

recipes.title: Red Velvet Cheesecake Swirl Cupcakes

winePairing.pairingText: Cupcakes can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Prepare red velvet cake batter according to package. Spoon batter into a cupcake pan filled with paper liners. Fill each cup ½ full.In a separate bowl whip together the cream cheese, egg, sugar and vanilla until well incorporated.Spoon 1½ to 2 Tbsp of the cream cheese mixture on top of each of the cake batter filled cups.Use a butter knife to swirl the cheesecake by moving it up and down. Then left to right through the batter.Place in the oven and bake for 20-24 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.Cool and top with Sweetened whipped cream if desired.Store uneaten cupcakes in an airtight container in the fridge.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.Prepare red velvet cake batter according to package. Spoon batter into a cupcake pan filled with paper liners. Fill each cup ½ full.In a separate bowl whip together the cream cheese, egg, sugar and vanilla until well incorporated.Spoon 1½ to 2 Tbsp of the cream cheese mixture on top of each of the cake batter filled cups.Use a butter knife to swirl the cheesecake by moving it up and down. Then left to right through the batter.

Place in the oven and bake for 20-24 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.Cool and top with Sweetened whipped cream if desired.Store uneaten cupcakes in an airtight container in the fridge.
